intro: Chaetocalyx ilheoticus, commonly known as the Ilheus hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
